title: Atlanta (board game)
text:
Atlanta Civil War Campaign Game is an <a href="American%20Civil%20War">American Civil War</a> <a href="board%20wargame">board wargame</a> published by <a href="Guidon%20Games">Guidon Games</a> in <a href="1973%20in%20games">1973</a>.
Description.
"Atlanta Civil War Campaign Game" is a two-player or two-team wargame that simulates the series of battles in 1864 known as the <a href="Battle%20of%20Atlanta">Battle of Atlanta</a>. The boxed set includes
The players can choose to play individual battles (<a href="Rocky%20Face%20Ridge">Rocky Face Ridge</a>, Pumpkin Vine Creek, <a href="Battle%20of%20Kennesaw%20Mountain">Kennesaw Mountain</a>, or <a href="Battle%20of%20Peachtree%20Creek">Peachtree Creek</a>), or can play all of them as an extended campaign.
Publication history.
"Atlanta Civil War Campaign Game" was designed by Guidon Games owner <a href="Don%20Lowry">Don Lowry</a>, and published by Guidon Games in 1973.
